security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged 735 issues, but all are false positives. Findings originated from documentation files where markdown code formatting was misidentified as shell execution, placeholder API keys were flagged as credentials, and legitimate file+network patterns were marked as dangerous. Actual Python scripts are benign document conversion utilities from Microsoft.

content.value_statement: Convert PDF, DOCX, PPTX, images, and other documents to clean Markdown format. Supports OCR for images, transcription for audio, and optional AI-enhanced image descriptions for better LLM processing.
actual_capabilities: Convert PDF, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX to Markdown
Extract text from images using OCR
Generate AI-enhanced image descriptions via OpenRouter
Batch convert multiple files in parallel
limitations: Requires installation of optional dependencies for specific formats
AI image descriptions require OpenRouter API key
OCR quality depends on image clarity and Tesseract installation
Large files may require additional processing time

prompt_templates.title: Basic Conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the markitdown skill to convert {filename.pdf} to Markdown and save it as {filename.md}

output: Extracted title, author, and all text content

best_practices: Install optional dependencies for the file formats you need (pip install 'markitdown[pdf,docx,pptx]')
Provide your OpenRouter API key via OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable for AI features
Use batch_convert.py with --recursive flag for processing large document collections
anti_patterns: Do not convert sensitive documents without reviewing the output first
Avoid processing files in place - always specify a separate output directory
Do not share API keys in prompts or commit them to version control

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: PDF, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX, images (JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP), audio (WAV, MP3), HTML, CSV, JSON, XML, ZIP, EPUB, and YouTube URLs.

faq.question: Do I need to install additional dependencies?
faq.answer: Base installation handles basic formats. Install extras like pip install 'markitdown[pdf]' for PDF support or 'markitdown[all]' for everything.

faq.question: How do I enable AI image descriptions?
faq.answer: Set OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable. The convert_with_ai.py script or MarkItDown with llm_client parameter will use it automatically.

faq.question: Can this process scanned documents?
faq.answer: Yes, install Tesseract OCR (brew install tesseract or apt-get install tesseract-ocr) for optical character recognition on scanned PDFs and images.

faq.question: How fast is batch conversion?
faq.answer: batch_convert.py supports parallel processing. Use --workers flag to control concurrency. Default is 4 parallel conversions.

faq.question: Are my documents sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Only if using AI image descriptions with OpenRouter. Regular conversion runs entirely locally. You control when network access occurs.
